titles.title: To provide that land which is owned by the Seminole Tribe of Florida but which is not held in trust by the United States for the Tribe may be mortgaged, leased, or transferred by the Tribe without further approval by the United States.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 107-692.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 430.

bill.summary: 9/25/2002--Reported to House amended. Allows the Seminole Tribe of Florida to mortgage, lease, sell, convey, warrant, or otherwise transfer, without further U.S. approval, all or any part of its interest in any real property held by the Tribe on September 1, 2002, that is not held in trust by the United States.
